titleStmt.title: To RICHARD CREED,Richard Creed, Secretary, London & Birmingham Railway, 1833-46; later joint Secretary of the London & North Western Railway. 19 JULY 1842

body.p: Mr Charles Dickens presents his compliments to Mr Creed, and begs to reply to his enquiry. – Mr Dickens feared, from several slight circumstances which attracted his notice in the application, that it was a case of the nature described by Mr Creed. He has therefore taken care that his Mite should reach the wife;CD’s accounts do not show an obvious bank payment relating to this letter; the use of "Mite" may suggest a small cash payment, rather than a cheque. and not the husband.
